title: MS AccessAbs()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessAbs()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the absolute value of a number:
SELECT Abs(-243.5) AS AbsNum;

Definition and Usage
The Abs() function returns the absolute (positive) value of a number.
Syntax
Abs(
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. A numeric value
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessAbs()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessAbs()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessAbs()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
